extendedIngredients.name: black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: black beans, quartered cherry tomatoes, diced avocado for topping

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: large pinch kosher salt & freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: quinoa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup dry quinoa, cooked according to package directions, cooled

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined (51-60 count; adjust cooking time if you use larger shrimp)
metaInformation: (51-60 count; adjust cooking time if you use larger shrimp)

recipes.title: blackened shrimp bowls with salsa ranch quinoa

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 21 dollars.

productMatches.title: Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: This wine has beautiful lifted pear and jasmine characters on the nose with some hints of creamy, leesy characters underneath. Whilst the powerful palate is packed with flavor, it also has added complexity and weight as a result of the wild barrel ferment. The wine finishes with lovely crisp natural acidity.

recipes.instructions: InstructionsPreheat oven to 400F.Place 1/2 avocado, yogurt, Hidden Valley Salsa Ranch, water, salt and pepper into a blender or food processor. Blend until very smooth.Toss sauce with quinoa and set aside. (Taste and season the quinoa after mixing in the sauce)Place shrimp on baking sheet and toss with extra-virgin olive oil. Sprinkle blackening spice over and toss well. Roast shrimp for approximately 5 minutes, until just cooked through (remove shrimp from hot baking sheet or they will continue to cook). Set aside.Divide quinoa into four bowls. Top each with black beans, quartered cherry tomatoes and diced avocado, then top each with 1/4 of the shrimp.Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley, if desired.

steps.step: Place 1/2 avocado, yogurt, Hidden Valley Salsa Ranch, water, salt and pepper into a blender or food processor. Blend until very smooth.Toss sauce with quinoa and set aside. (Taste and season the quinoa after mixing in the sauce)

Place shrimp on baking sheet and toss with extra-virgin olive oil. Sprinkle blackening spice over and toss well. Roast shrimp for approximately 5 minutes, until just cooked through (remove shrimp from hot baking sheet or they will continue to cook). Set aside.Divide quinoa into four bowls. Top each with black beans, quartered cherry tomatoes and diced avocado, then top each with 1/4 of the shrimp.Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley, if desired.
